Articles.Content:
<Frog>

Take off and land repeatedly without dying. Highest amount of 'Bounces' wins.

<Cloud>

Hover at a constant height for as long as possible. Longest time wins.

<Swing and a Miss>

Pull off a death-defying dive. The closest to the Ground wins.

-New-

<Light as a....>

Achieve any orbit with less than 10 parts. (Stock and Sunday Punch parts only) Least Amount of parts wins.

<Somewhere not in the Atmosphere......>

Get as far away from Kearth as possible with only Stock and Sunday Parts. Furthest distance wins.

>RULE<

Screen-shots are needed to verify that you're telling the truth. (You Liars.)

Spoils of War(?)

Winners receive bragging rights and Jeb will show you his awesome car. The secrets of the Universe. his other car. why he is always smiling. Something Cool. Something.

Also, once these three get old (At least five people even bother with them) I'll think up three more. (Suggestions are cool too.)

Edit1:I added two more achievements off the top of my head, just because I felt like it. 8)

Regarding your last two:

6 stock parts to orbit: capsule, LFTx3, LFE, Decoupler. The decoupler on the bottom breaks the 'sticky' launch pad, allowing you to get off the ground on one engine.

Once your ship has reached escape velocity, your 'highest altitude' is determined entirely by how long you choose to let the flight drag on, because you will just keep going up.
Heh, I don't think that matters all that much. It's not as if people are lining up to try em.
